intro: Stylophyllum hassei, commonly known as the sea holly, is a marine flowering plant found in shallow coastal waters. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, leaf-like structures. The plant produces small, bright blue flowers that bloom during the summer months. Stylophyllum hassei thrives in sandy or muddy substrates and is often found in tide pools. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in coastal ecosystems.
